data.title: All 33 Kate Capshaw Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the world of one of Hollywood’s most iconic actresses with our roundup of Kate Capshaw Movies. From her breakout role in Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom to her memorable…
data.text:
Get ready to dive into the world of one of Hollywood’s most iconic actresses with our roundup of Kate Capshaw Movies. From her breakout role in Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom to her memorable performances in other blockbuster films, we’ll take a look at the diverse and captivating career of this talented actress. Join us as we explore the movies that have made Kate Capshaw a household name and a true star of the silver screen.

As an Amazon™ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. A Little Sex (1982)

A Little Sex” (1982) is a hilarious and witty comedy-romance film that delves into the chaotic world of infidelity. Following the journey of a man who is determined to master the art of infidelity, the film is a whirlwind of comedy, romance, and unexpected twists.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Best Defense (1984)

In the comedy-war film “Best Defense, “ released in 1984, we follow two characters: a military weapons engineer and a tank commander. The engineer is faced with the challenge of doing his job responsibly, while the tank commander must live with the consequences of his actions in combat years later.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)

Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom is a thrilling adventure set in 1935 India, where the iconic archaeologist, Indiana Jones, played by Harrison Ford, becomes the unlikely hero for a small village seeking to reclaim a precious rock stolen by a secret cult. As he delves beneath the catacombs of an ancient palace, Jones must confront ancient curses, ruthless mercenaries, and a perilous journey through the depths of India and Shanghai China.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Dreamscape (1984)

Dreamscape, “ a thrilling 1984 sci-fi film starring Dennis Quaid, Max von Sydow, and Christopher Plummer, follows a man with the extraordinary ability to enter and manipulate people’s dreams. When this psychic is recruited by a government agency to help cure the President’s recurring nightmares about nuclear war, he stumbles upon an assassination plot that disrupts this mission.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. Code Name: Dancer (1987)

Code Name: Dancer, released in 1987, follows the story of Annie, a seemingly ordinary kindergarten teacher living the ideal yuppy lifestyle with her husband. However, things take a surprising turn when she receives a mysterious phone call at work containing coded messages about “The Dancer” and a “candy store. “ Before she knows it, Annie finds herself knee-deep in a thrilling adventure, entangled with the CIA, ex-lovers, and the dangerous world of espionage.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. The Quick and the Dead (1987)

In the rugged wilderness of the Old West, a lone rider arrives at a family’s homestead, seeking refuge after a brutal gang attack. Known only as “the man with no name, “ this mysterious stranger brings with him an air of danger and intrigue. As tensions rise and the family is forced to protect their home and loved ones from the relentless pursuit of their merciless attackers, the man with no name must confront his own past and make the ultimate choice between justice and revenge.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Black Rain (1989)

In the gritty streets of New York City, two hardened cops, Nick Wildes and Charlie McGrath, find themselves thrown into an unfamiliar world when they are tasked with escorting a dangerous Yakuza member back to Japan for extradition. As they embark on their perilous journey, the language barrier and stark cultural differences pose constant challenges for the officers.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. My Heroes Have Always Been Cowboys (1991)

My Heroes Have Always Been Cowboys” is a captivating drama-western film from 1991 — a heart-warming tale set in Tulsa, Oklahoma. This 1 hour and 46-minute flick follows the journey of a professional bull rider who decides to quit his line of work after suffering a serious injury.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Love Affair (1994)

Love Affair, released in 1994 and starring Warren Beatty and Annette Bening, tells the story of two people, both with fiancés, who meet on a plane bound for Sydney. When tragedy strikes and they’re forced into a makeshift evacuation, they find themselves falling for each other amidst the chaos.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Next Door (1994)

Next Door” is a hilarious and heartfelt comedy-drama that explores the complexities of neighborly relationships. Set in 1994, Matt and Karen find themselves in a seemingly innocuous feud with their inconsiderate neighbors, whose lawn sprinkler inadvertently drowns their flowers. As tensions escalate, a series of tit-for-tat actions ensue, culminating in a whirlwind of hilarity and chaos.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. How to Make an American Quilt (1995)

How to Make an American Quilt” is a heartwarming comedy-drama film released in 1995, with a runtime of 1 hour and 57 minutes. The film, directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse, follows the story of a young woman named Finn Dodd as she prepares for her wedding. Finn listens as her elders, played by the talented actresses Ellen Burstyn and Anne Bancroft, share tales of romance and heartbreak while constructing a quilt. The film is set to a charming blend of classical and wedding music, adding to its overall charm.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. Just Cause (1995)

Just Cause is a gripping crime-drama, released in 1995, starring Sean Connery, Laurence Fishburne, and Kate Capshaw. The movie centers on a Harvard professor who, after a 25-year hiatus from the courtroom, dives into the case of a young African American man facing the death penalty for the gruesome murder of a child.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. The Locusts (1997)

In the enigmatic 1997 drama “The Locusts, “ a mysterious drifter enters a small Kansas town, looking for work. After he lands a job at a local cattle ranch, he encounters the captivating Kitty, with whom he quickly falls in love. However, he soon finds himself entangled in a perilous love triangle, which spills into the realm of darkness and seduction. As the secrets of the town and the ranch’s family are revealed, the drifter faces a harrowing dilemma: choose between his forbidden passion or escape its menacing grip.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. The Alarmist (1997)

Prepare for a rollercoaster ride of satire and dark humor in “The Alarmist” (1997), originally known as “Life During Wartime. “ Directed by Evan Dunsky and written by Keith Reddin and Evan Dunsky, this film has an ensemble cast that includes stars like David Arquette and Stanley Tucci. Set in an alarm system installation company, the film tells the story of a young, ambitious salesman who pursues a sexual relationship with a woman client.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. A Girl Thing (2001)

A Girl Thing” is a captivating drama set in New York City, following the journey of four different women as they navigate their way through various romantic and personal challenges. Each woman faces distinct life situations, including attraction to another woman, strained family relations between three sisters, a cheating husband, and seeking revenge after being unexpectedly fired from their job.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. Indiana Jones: Making the Trilogy (2003)

Dive into the fascinating journey of creating one of the most iconic film franchises of all time — Indiana Jones. With a runtime of 2 hours and 7 minutes, this documentary follows George Lucas, Steven Spielberg, and Lawrence Kasdan as they share their struggles and passions behind the making of the Indiana Jones Trilogy.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

25. The 78th Annual Academy Awards (2006)

Get ready for an unforgettable night of glamour, drama, and high stakes as you join host Jon Stewart for the 78th Annual Academy Awards! . This star-studded ceremony, broadcast in March of 2006, celebrates the year’s most iconic films, including “Brokeback Mountain, “ “Capote, “ “Crash, “ “Good Night, and Good Luck, “ and “Munich. “ As you tune in to witness the magic unfold, prepare yourselves for an evening filled with captivating performances, unexpected surprises, and an awe-inspiring tribute to the timeless power of cinema.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. The 68th Annual Golden Globe Awards (2011)

Prepare to witness the extravagance and star-studded glamour of the 68th Annual Golden Globe Awards! . Hosted by the witty and irreverent Ricky Gervais, this unforgettable night is filled with laughter, music, and the most anticipated awards in Hollywood. Join Amy Adams, Max Adler, and a star-studded ensemble of nominees as they come together to celebrate the year’s best in film and television.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art
